name: Beyond Aero
headline: First electric business aircraft designed for hydrogen propulsion
description:
Beyond Aero was founded to meet the challenges of climate change and is developing the first hydrogen-powered electric business aircraft. 
The company is on a mission to make aviation electric, starting with business aviation since private jet are the most emissions-intensive segment per passenger, producing ten times more CO2 per person than commercial flights. 
Beyond Aero has hit significant technical milestones, achieving France's first manned fully hydrogen-electric flight earlier this year and appointing Luiz Oliveira, former advisor on Embraer’s hybrid hydrogen program, as Chief Engineer. Beyond Aero has secured $914 million in Letters of Intent (LOIs) for 108 aircraft and earned multiple awards, including Brilliant Minds and the Sustainable Aviation Challenge by the World Economic Forum, joining the First Movers Coalition.

**Beyond Aero: Pioneering Hydrogen-Powered Aviation**

Founded in 2020 and part of Y Combinator's Winter 2022 batch, Beyond Aero is fast becoming a key player in the aviation industry. The company's mission is ambitious yet straightforward: to address climate change by developing the world's first electric business aircraft powered by hydrogen propulsion.

Why focus on business aviation? Because it's the most emissions-intensive segment of air travel, producing up to ten times more CO2 per passenger compared to commercial flights. This makes Beyond Aero's work not just innovative, but necessary.

The team at Beyond Aero, which has grown to around 50 employees, has already reached notable achievements. Earlier this year, they executed France's first manned fully hydrogen-electric flight — a significant milestone. Furthermore, they've appointed Luiz Oliveira, a veteran of Embraer’s hybrid hydrogen program, as Chief Engineer, which speaks volumes about their expertise in this innovative domain.

Financially, Beyond Aero is making waves. They've secured $914 million in Letters of Intent for 108 aircraft and have garnered multiple accolades, including recognition from the World Economic Forum for their sustainable aviation initiatives.

Their flagship aircraft, named "One," aims to break new ground, capable of flying over 800 nautical miles using hydrogen propulsion. This isn't just a conceptual design; it’s a step towards a sustainable future for aviation.

The company is also keen on expanding its team, inviting those who dare to think beyond traditional aviation to join them in their mission. With strong backing and an innovative spirit, Beyond Aero stands at the forefront of a much-needed transformation in how we think about air travel.

For more information or to explore opportunities, visit their [official website](https://www.beyond-aero.com/). 

In short, Beyond Aero is not just flying into the future; they're redefining it.
